intro: Colchicum tuviae, commonly known as the Tuvinian colchicum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Colchicaceae and is characterized by its striking, violet-blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces a tall, leafless stem that bears a single, showy flower with reflexed petals. Its leaves are basal, forming a rosette, and are typically lance-shaped with a bluish-green hue. Colchicum tuviae is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
